qa.question: Summarize the main contribution in 3 bullets.
qa.answer:
The main contributions of Project Alpha are:

- **Hybrid retrieval**: We combine BM25 lexical search with dense vector search, achieving 12% improvement over dense-only baselines on the BEIR benchmark. [Source: sample.txt, Locator: Key contributions in three bullets: (chunk 0)]
- **Section-aware chunking**: We propose chunking at semantic boundaries (paragraphs, sections) rather than fixed token windows, reducing citation errors by 23%. [Source: sample.txt, Locator: Key contributions in three bullets: (chunk 2)]
- **Adaptive retrieval**: The system dynamically adjusts the number of retrieved chunks (k) based on query complexity, measured by entropy of the initial retrieval distribution. [Source: sample.txt, Locator: Key contributions in three bullets: (chunk 3)]
